reasoning: Recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP), caused by HPV infection, has estimated incidence of 3-5 per 100k children per year globally. Adult-onset RRP is less common (~1 per 100k adults). Combined pediatric and adult incidence approximated at ~4-5 per 100k population per year.
source: Derkay CS. (2003). Recurrent respiratory papillomatosis. Laryngoscope. 113(8):1273-1277
